intro: Chamaesyce glyptosperma, commonly known as the smoothleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in umbels. It plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for various insects.
